Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a red pottery ribbed vessel, the fabric is relatively coarse and grey-black in section, the interior is covered with a light-brown deposit, the exterior is covered with a light-brown slip and very faint traces of six lines of Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394405) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394405)
